page.title: 06HOUSING 3
page.content: From newspaper advertisements during the summer of 1985 average house prices were discovered to be as follows: 1 bed. barn conversion - Â£42 000 2 bed. cottages - Â£49 000 3 bed. detached chalet-bungalows modern construction - Â£58 000 3 bed. detched new cottages Â£65 000 Quarry House set in 8 acres of grounds -Â£250 000 It is most unlikely that a young couple could purchase a family home in the area other than a council house for less than Â£55 000.There is a total absence of properties suitable as starter homes.In fact the market & design of new homes in the area is aimed at the upper end of the market particularly retired people.Inevitably unless there is a drastic change in policy the young will be forced out.
